attributes.action: Sugar Tax: Government to re-debate Sugar Tax and potentially scrap Sugar Tax
attributes.background: Debate to consider: undesirable side effects of artificial sweeteners (AS); aspartame approved at current levels of consumption. Levels may increase due to ST; choice to consume natural product (sugar); tax from ST to research health impact of AS and fund nutrition education
attributes.additional_details: The Sugar Tax compromises and demonizes the use of a natural substance and promotes synthesized products. Sugar has been used for centuries to sweeten food. We know the side effects of its excessive consumption. In comparison, artificial sweeteners are a new phenomenon. Not enough conclusive research has been carried out for the Government to decree that sweeteners are a healthy alternative to sugar. For example, research into aspartame concluded it is both safe and a potential source of cancer.

attributes.action: Discontinue the practice of Prime Minister's Questions
attributes.background:
The ongoing insult to the UK citizens intelligence every Wednesday in Parliament due to the dishonesty and insult hurling which has become the norm under recent Prime Ministers. 
The establishment of  rules and disciplines are needed to allow this to become a meaningful and accountable process.

attributes.action: Legislation to require financial entities to consider fairly all applicants
attributes.background: With a large number of migrants currently living in the UK whom are unable to register in the Electoral Roll. I consider is discriminatory to have a negative impact in the credit report due to this factor. Many financial institutions will deny services without 3 years of UK address history.
attributes.additional_details: To be fair foreign address history should be considered or the address history requirement be limited to only the last UK address. If a person is not registered on the Electoral Roll can experience delays when applying for credit, and firms may turn down the application flatly if they can’t confirm where the person lives. An alternative, open register should be available to legal residents of the UK, in order for credit scoring companies and other financial institutions can confirm addresses.

attributes.action: Ban Chewing Gum from being sold in the UK. Make towns cleaner and healthier.
attributes.background: No matter where you go in the UK, most towns and cities will have areas that have a high level of chewing gum spread across pavements and walkways. Not only is unsightly, embarrassing and spreads germs. It costs councils lots of money to sort out. Money that could be used elsewhere i.e. NHS etc.

attributes.action: Electric Cars should make a significant noise when moving for safety
attributes.background: We teach "stop, look and LISTEN" when teaching the green cross code. Also for people who rely on their sense of hearing to get about, electric cars are dangerous as they may believe the road to be clear when it is not. The sounds of conventional cars are a big part in keeping people safe
attributes.additional_details: The solution would be as simply as placing a wind (or in this case movement) activated noise maker on the roof of the car. This is just a suggestion of course, the important part is to make electric and hybrid automobiles make a noise like a conventional car does to alert pedestrians to their presence.

attributes.action: Require all classrooms to have CCTV to help prevent bullying
attributes.background: Bullying needs to be talked about, and dealt with seriously because kids don't talk because they think no one would believe them. CCTV in classrooms will stop this.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the Government to require all schools to have CCTV and sound equipment in all classrooms, to show children that they take bullying seriously.

attributes.action: Ban airlines' seat allocation fees for families
attributes.background: Nowadays marketing is getting mad and air companies are trying to get more monies from people for needless services, where there should a must. Children and families are paying nearly £100 extra to be sure that they will sit together with their children or relatives, husbands, wife on airplanes.
attributes.additional_details:
This fee must be banned for families, as this is extra money on top of the paid charges for holidays, which already cost a lot. 
Air companies are making money from nothing.

attributes.action: No exemption of neutralisation fee for residents - Equal and fair Treatment
attributes.background:
Everyone should be treated equally and fairly. 
If any nation is exempted everyone should be exempted and refunded accordingly. 
It's the policy of state, cannot be a favour.
attributes.additional_details:
Polish national are asking for exemption of Neturalisation fee which I see very unfair to other UK Residence permit holders.

All residents must be weight in same scale. 
Britain ruled most of works alone and can stand strong on its own feet.
Britain is not dependent on any nation.

attributes.action: Give more advice and provide help for free to the parents of obese children.
attributes.background: Children who are obese have higher risks of heart disease and other illnesses so it would be very important to lower the numbers of kids who are in need of help. Providing more help by making their parents aware of this and sending them free leaflets on how to help their child(ren) would be helpful.
attributes.additional_details: The number of obese children would change dramatically and fall if further support was given to parents or careers of children. Obesity levels in the UK are really high compared to other European countries and the world. Meal plans, guidance and leaflets with facts on obesity should be given to parents or careers so they can help their child lose weight and decrease chances of breathing difficulty, high blood pressure or a stroke in the future.

attributes.action: Nobody should be able to contest a Will.
attributes.background: If someone makes a Will when of sound mind then their wishes should be respected. If Wills can be contested then what is the point in paying a solicitor to write one in the first place?

attributes.action: Force any MP or someone standing as an MP, caught lying, to resign
attributes.background:
Any MP or someone standing as an MP who is caught blatantly lying for personal or political gain or for any reason to resign and never be allowed to stand again as an MP
We the people deserve trustworthy MPs and candidates

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for people who have life saving medication.
attributes.background: People who have to pay for prescriptions when they have to take medication for life is wrong. They can't afford it and it is a necessity for them. If they can't afford it, it could mean life or death for them. It's wrong it should be free!

attributes.action: Allow Motorcross bikes to ride in public parks or fields
attributes.background: Allow Motorcross bikes to be ridden in fields or parks instead of being chased by police

attributes.action: Canadian citizens should be allowed to live in the UK without a residence visa.
attributes.background: Canadians have the oath to The Queen. The UK government should consider Canadians as their fellow home citizens. Canadians should not be treated as foreigners and I believe they should not be restricted to live in their second home by holding a residence visa!
attributes.additional_details: Canadian banknotes, coins, visas and many of the other legal identities have a picture of The Queen.

attributes.action: Chain restaurants and cafes have to offer blue badge tables for wheelchair users
attributes.background: It should be a legal requirement for large chain restaurants and cafes to have a blue badge table, where wheelchair bound citizens feel as though they can be comfortable and not in the way.
attributes.additional_details:
My mother recently suffered a stroke and is now wheelchair bound. As a strong independent woman, she has lost alot yet loves to enjoy a nice meal or coffee on a day out. However many times we will enter a restaurant or cafe to find that their isn't a spot or enough space. This means a simple journey to a cafe can lead to looking through 3 or 4 different ones. 

In 2017, this should not be an issue, parking is supplied for the less abled, this should be a legal requirement.

attributes.action: Public sector Pension to transfer to partner without the need to be married.
attributes.background: More and more people choose to live together without feeling the need to marry. However we still have certain pension company's that still refuse to recognise that you exist as a loving and committed couple if you don't marry. This needs to change. Please sign and show your support.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently a high court ruling of a case in Ireland was won by a widower. They had been a couple for 10 years and had recently become engaged. Tragically her fiancé died at 43 years old. She was then told by the pension company that she wouldn't be eligible to claim his pension due to not being married. She then had to fight and with the support of a crowd funding page
successfully won her case.

attributes.action: Designate certain careers as a 'Public Service Vocation' with specific benefits.
attributes.background: Doctors, nurses, teachers, the military, social workers and prison officers work, primarily, to provide and care for others and are not driven by financial rewards. This should be recognized by designating certain jobs as a 'Public Service Vocation' with enhanced benefits.
attributes.additional_details: Those who in the caring professions work selflessly in the community in schools, hospitals, prisons and in the armed forces. As they are not working for their own benefit and cannot, in the majority of cases, enhance their own pay packet by working any harder, they deserve special status in the tax system. They also deserve an entitlement to extended breaks in their working lives for rest and professional development so that they do not get 'burnt out' but enjoy long and fruitful careers.

attributes.action: Scrap the NHS.
attributes.background:
The NHS is costing too much money.
People don't need other people's money to pay for their healthcare.
People should have to get private health insurance so they're always covered.
The government should only provide it for those who can't afford insurance or can't get it for any other reason.
attributes.additional_details:
The following is statistical and anecdotal evidence that private healthcare works better than that which is provided by the government.
In the United States (which has private healthcare system), they have three times as many mammograms per person than in Europe.
3.7 million people are currently waiting for healthcare.
In Essex, doctors twice cancelled potentially life-saving surgery for a patient with oesophageal cancer because there were no free beds in the intensive care unit.

attributes.action: Offer a National Savings & Investments Product that pays a 6% interest rate.
attributes.background: 21 Million Savers have again sustained a new blow, following National Savings interest rates recently being cut by up to 0.25 per cent.The Prime Minister, The Rt. Hon. Theresa May, had "pledged" to help those battered by record low interest rates, which have remained at a record low since 2008.
attributes.additional_details: On the one hand the Government maintains that it wants to champion Savers, yet on the other, it continues to cut rates.Savers have been punished time and time again.The Prime Minister has warned that rock bottom rates and quantitative easing had "bad side effects", including "making Savers poorer". She also stated " A change has got to come and we are going to deliver it". So please deliver it.The Government should offer through NS&I, a Savings Product which pays an interest rate of at least 6%.

attributes.action: Provide student loans for British students having to study abroad
attributes.background: Studying abroad is financially challenging, especially with the lack of support from your own country. Foreign students studying in England benefit from a student loan system, but British students studying abroad do not. The government should provide a student loans system for all British students.

attributes.action: Prevent owners taking their horses on main roads especially during peak hours.
attributes.background: Stop allowing horses to be ridden or pull a cart on main roads. Horses on main roads can cause serious danger and distress to the horse due to fast moving, loud vehicles. It can also cause major distruption for motorists who are often unable to over-take which can lead to queue build up.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 incidents involving horses ends in a fatality for individuals and almost always for the horse. Although accidents involving horses are not required to be recorded as an official incident, unless a person is injured, it happens quite frequently and can be traumatising for both horse owners and motorists. 
In the past, I have witnessed a horse being hit on a busy main road. The horse was badly injured and died at the scene. The owner of the horse was also injured and extremely traumatised.

attributes.action: Benefits for people who are diagnosed with mental health problems.
attributes.background: People who are diagnosed with life long mental health issues, that affect there quality of life, should not be discriminated, it is hard as it is to find and get support when you are diagnosed with mental health problems.
attributes.additional_details: People with mental health issues should be supported by the goverment, and evaluated to see if they are fit to work. There quality of life is much different, and  the goverment lacks the understanding of mental health conditions. It's is near impossible for somone with Bi-polar, ADHD or autisim to find work and should not be left abandoned by the goverment.

attributes.action: Make the Help to Buy 40% allowance available outside London in expensive areas
attributes.background: An interest free loan is available from the government for 5 years on a new build home. This is 40% in London and 20% outside London. Some areas of the UK, for example the South East, have house prices similar to London. In these areas the help should be proportionate.

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in Justine Greening, Secretary of State for Education
attributes.background: Since Justine Greening was appointed as Secretary of State for Education and Minister for Women and Equalities she has neglected to fulfil her responsibilities and to ensure that the DfE obtain all records/evidence in complaints against schools/governing bodies. Currently the DfE does not do this
attributes.additional_details: The Department of Education doesn’t obtain records when parents/students make a complaint against a school/governing body or other authorities if involved. It is vital for complaints where the school/governing body are not providing records/evidence that the DfE must obtain and forward them to the complainant to contribute. Student’s education is put at risk & their records contaminated with misleading information. The DfE complaints system must be overhauled & those responsible held accountable

attributes.action: Allocate funding for researching the possible treatments of Misophonia
attributes.background: Ryan Simpson is just one of many unfortunate people, whom have an abnormality in their nervous system that will cause them to be triggered by certain noises that others don't even hear. I ask the government to allocate funding to research a cure for this dreadful condition.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.itv.com/news/2017-02-03/scientists-discover-why-noisy-eating-can-make-people-angry/

attributes.action: Treat votes as a form of currency and make obtaining votes by deception a crime.
attributes.background: Votes are the currency of democracy. Those who solicit votes through false or misleading claims and actions should face the same legal sanctions as currently exist for monetary fraud. Treating votes as a limited form of currency allows those same laws to be used against dishonest campaigning.
attributes.additional_details: In the world of commerce, when you make deliberately misleading statements or engage in misleading acts designed to persuade people to part with money goods or services you can be taken to court and prosecuted. If votes were classed as a non-transferable, time limited unit of currency, the same body of law and evidential tests that apply to monetary fraud could be applied to politicians and their supporters who use deception and falsehoods when marketing themselves to the electorate.

attributes.action: Lower taxes of pensions for U.K. Armed Forces Officers who served for 20 years
attributes.background: U.K. Armed Forces Officers get paid pensions from the Govenment, however, the government then tax it up to 40%, even though they are risking their lives for the country.

attributes.action: Shorten School Days For Public High Schools
attributes.background: When I go to school all the work piles up sometimes and becomes really stressful, however when I get home there is not enough time to relax, do work, eat then sleep enough for the next day of school, I know a lot of others feel this way and I hope this gets solved.

attributes.action: Make the Pigeon our first national bird!
attributes.background: Pigeons are everywhere and are part of our current day-to-day lives.

attributes.action: Speed up A&E times in UK hospitals
attributes.background: A&E's in the UK have long waiting times to see a nurse or a doctor in the hospital (including emergencies). This has put a lot of pressure on NHS staff which has resulted in longer times to wait.
attributes.additional_details:
- Aim is to speed up the waiting times within UK hospitals.
- Put more NHS nurses and doctors back onto wards.

attributes.action: Exempt Landlords from Stamp Duty if let to a local authority or Housing Trust
attributes.background:
Growing shortage of affordable property to rent.

Incentivise Landlords to rent to the public sector for a minimum of 5 years below market rates, in return for tax and duty relief.

Also introduce enhanced Interest Relief for long term Landlords committing to a 10 year or more investment term.
attributes.additional_details:
Stamp Duty & the reduction in interest relief has made investment in residential property much less favourable, the result, less investment in BuytoLet (BTL) properties and landlords have been selling existing stock ahead of the changes.

This reduction in stock and the high demand, will inevitably lead to  rent increases.

Incentivise investment by exempting Stamp Duty on all property let to the public sector for a 5 years term, long term landlords should benefit from enhanced interest relief

attributes.action: Make all Utility Companies publicly owned & Running Costs paid by the Tax Payer
attributes.background: I want the government to make all Utility Companies publicly owned as Non Profit Companies & cover all Running Costs by the Tax Payer. This will ensure the disabled, elderly & people out of work can heat their houses & not have to worry about bailiffs coming to their door for non payment of bills.
attributes.additional_details: Losing your job, being elderly or disabled is financially hard enough. Many have to deal with unscrupulous bailiffs for non payment of utility bills, leaving some feeling suicidal. These vulnerable people should not be asked to pay for utility bills that they cannot afford. However, this also means that the government can pay them less benefits as their utility bills are already covered. Plus if utility companies are non profit and publicly owned, everyone's bills will be cheaper to begin with.

attributes.action: Reform the public broadcasting licensing law.
attributes.background:
At the moment you cannot listen to a radio or play your own music in your place of work without a public broadcasting license. This includes in your own home if you are working from there. 

The current law isn't in the spirit of its intent, which is to require a media company to get a license.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.ppluk.com/

attributes.action: Theory test for car license has to be in all languages.
attributes.background: Allow people from different countries to get the license in their own language.

attributes.action: Allow people to do any reasonable course & still receive benefits.
attributes.background: People on jobseekers should be able to study full-time or part-time on any appropriate course without losing money, even if that course takes longer than 8 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
On job seekers, they have to look for work for 35 hours a week. If they want to go to college they cannot claim benefits, so no income even though they want to get off jobseekers. We have low skilled people being forced to remain that way.

I am from a working class town, hundreds of people on job seekers. Many I meet want to go to college and do different courses, not only the basic courses, to achieve skills. If they choose to go to college they won't meet the 35 hours a week for seeking jobs and can’t claim help, so they are not allowed to improve as they won't be able to live without benefits. They become trapped in a life that has little sign of improving.

attributes.action: Create independent organisations to run the NHS and Education
attributes.background: The NHS and Education are perpetual footballs for politicians.  They see them as their way of "making policy" and "changing Britain".  In the same way as was done with the Bank of England, both the NHS and Education should be taken out of politics, and run by independent, expert organisations.
attributes.additional_details: Let's stop perpetual political reforms of the NHS and Education in the UK, and create stability.  Let's also stop politicians who have zero experience in health or education from making policy, and leave instead trust these tasks to panels of experts.  Only this way can be bring stability to, and take forward, our beloved organisations.

attributes.action: Make it law for any petition with 300k+ signatures to actually be debated
attributes.background: It is disingenuous of the government to state they will only consider debating a petition if it reaches 100k. I propose that if a petition reaches 300k it must be debated whether or not the subject has been debated on a previous occasion. We must have a mechanism that ensure debates are held.

attributes.action: Put a public multi-section recycling bin on over 50% of Britain's roads
attributes.background: Roads like mine don't have enough regular bins. The country simply needs more if you expect people not to litter or have recyclable items end up in landfill. Give us lot a chance to have nicer places to live. Give us somewhere to put our rubbish and recyclable items when we're out and about.
attributes.additional_details: There are about 250,000 roads or ways in the UK, so it would be too costly to cover them but we need to start somewhere.

attributes.action: Road improvements to dual carriageway between Polegate to Lewis
attributes.background: With the increased housing developments in and around Eastbourne and Polegate causing more traffic congestion along the A27 between Polegate to Lewis it's now time to dual carriageway this section of road

attributes.action: Make training courses VAT exempt to encourage young people to learn new skills
attributes.background: I believe that training course should be VAT exempt as it helps young people learn new skills. VAT can be extremely expensive on week long course and puts may off taking them. By removing VAT from these courses it would encourage employers to invest in training to develop their employees.

attributes.action: Change the way that benefits are calculated to take cost of living into account
attributes.background: Benefit claimants living in an area where the cost of living is particularly high are at a disadvantage. Local Housing Allowance takes property prices in the applicant's area into consideration when calculating Housing Benefit entitlement, and I believe benefit rates should be calculated similarly

attributes.action: £1pw contribution to help fund NHS by ALL adults irrespective of age and income
attributes.background: I propose an idea to help fund our beloved NHS and Care Services  before they collapse under the pressure. A compulsory contribution of £1pw from all adults, controversially regardless of age and income. This would raise around 2.6b a year.
attributes.additional_details: I have calculated £2.6b a year by using the simple calculation of approx 50m adults (over 16) in UK x £1 = £50m x 52 wks = £2.600.000.000. 16 would be the starting age if not in education. For this to work I believe everyone needs to contribute. It would be easy to start excluding people because of age and income etc but this would put a greater financial burden on fewer people who would resist the charges. The NHS is freely available to all, so a small weekly contribution of £1 seems fair.

attributes.action: Allow those 18+ with ID to buy alcohol with someone under 18 present.
attributes.background: I went shopping for Christmas with a friend, wanted to buy a bottle of Baileys for the father in law, I'm 18 and my friend is 17, they would not let me have it because she did not have ID. If you're 18 you should get served. Under 18s will find a way to get alcohol no matter what anyway.
attributes.additional_details: Also, many mothers have been declined to buy alcohol for themselves because they're with their children who are not 18. Are mothers expected to abandon their children now so they can buy a bottle of wine? No.

attributes.action: Include HGV training to the Government backed 24+ Advanced Learning Loans.
attributes.background: To expand the 24+ advanced learning government backed loan to cover HGV license acquisition. There is currently a shortage of 45-50,000 drivers in the UK. Other industries are benefiting from the loan but not an industry that can create 50,000 jobs & whereby the loan could be paid back quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
Driver shortage- http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/oct/25/lorry-driver-shortage-christmas-deliveries-road-haulage-association

Courses covered: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/advanced-learner-loans-qualifications-catalogue

Ave pay for Class 1 (HGV 1) Driver £28,362 PA 
http://www.totaljobs.com/salary-checker/average-class-1-driver-salary

attributes.action: Change nhs policy that baby born before 24 weeks can intervene with life support
attributes.background: Babies born before 24 weeks in an NHS hospital should be given immediate emergency care to try get babies breathing if born not breathing or need the support when first born

attributes.action: Zero tax for 18-21 year olds in education and part time working
attributes.background: People between the age of 18 and 21 can't afford to pay tax on a part time job and don't have enough time for a full time job while in education.

attributes.action: Dissolve and amalgamate Cleveland Police in to Durham and North Yorkshire
attributes.background: The County of Cleveland no longer exists. Middlesbrough gets called North Yorkshire and Hartlepool Durham. The area has no identity, the Police Service is past its prime. Let's move forward & evolve; use the original boundaries of Durham and North Yorkshire as our Policing areas for 2020 & beyond.
attributes.additional_details:
The County of Cleveland was created in 1974 and named after the historic region, but not covering it all, and also including land north of the Tees that had until then been in Co Durham. It was situated around the Teesside urban area and included Middlesbrough, Stockton-on-Tees, Hartlepool and Redcar.
The county was abolished in 1996 with its boroughs becoming unitary authorities and the Tees re-established as the border between North Yorkshire and County Durham for ceremonial purposes only.

attributes.action: Prevent terrorist lorry attacks using temporary concrete stanchions.
attributes.background: Temporary concrete stanchions at public events and locations prevent terrorist lorry attacks. All UK locations where significant numbers of people are gathered in small spaces must be temporarily or permanently protected by suitable lorry stopping devices.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36806691 This is established technology - after the attack in Berlin these devices were deployed, they should have been deployed beforehand. To not do so is pure ignorance. The argument that they are an eyesore is invalid, you can dress them up like Santa or Snowmen. Whatever is in keeping with the event.

attributes.action: Clocks should be advanced one hour forward in winter instead of summer.
attributes.background: British Summer Time (BST) has been implemented since early 1900s. However, there is little benefit that can be gained. If instead of BST, we turn the clocks one hour forward in winter, we can benefit a lot from it. Particularly in those months when we need daylight i.e. October - February
attributes.additional_details:
An introduction of British Winter Time (BWT) as an alternative to BST would be helpful in winter such that: 

1. Decent daylight would be around 07:00 which is usually the time people are leaving for work. 
2. Sunset will be at approximately 16:30 instead of 15:30 nowadays. We can have more of daylight. 

We already have too much daylight in summer and sunset during summer is at a time when people are going to sleep. Decreasing one hour from both sunrise and sunset wouldn't make much difference.

attributes.action: Criminal Justice System to accept polygraph results as evidence.
attributes.background: For serious offences a Polygraph test should be used as evidence. For crimes such as historic child abuse where independent witnesses will not really exist. As nearly all children who are abused will by themselves. These results should be used or funding for research should be given.
attributes.additional_details:
We want the results to be used or funding granted to make these tests more accurate. 
 
Some people believe that the lie detectors are 90% accurate when other believe they are around 70% accurate. http://abcnews.go.com/US/story?id=92847

When eyewitness statements are used as evidence and their accuracy can be within this %.

What we want is some form of lie detector to be used in the near future as evidence.
